prompt: Photorealistic wide-angle shot of a flawlessly restored 1958 VMC Vendolator-81 Pepsi machine standing proudly in a brightly lit, modern collector's showroom with polished concrete floors. The machine, positioned slightly off-center to the left, gleams under soft gallery lighting, highlighting its vibrant red, white, and blue paint and polished chrome. The 16:9 aspect ratio captures the clean lines of the showroom environment, perhaps hinting at other collectibles blurred in the background, emphasizing the machine's high value and pristine condition. Professional photography, sharp focus, high detail. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: old-pepsi-machine-value-image-1.png

prompt: Atmospheric, photorealistic image of a dusty and weathered 1960s upright Pepsi vending machine discovered in the corner of an old, dimly lit barn. Shafts of sunlight cut through the dusty air, illuminating the machine's faded paint, minor rust spots, and patina. Composition uses the rule of thirds, placing the machine on the right side of the 16:9 frame, surrounded by rustic elements like old tools, wooden crates, or hay bales, suggesting its 'as-found' state and potential restoration value. Moody lighting, gritty texture, high detail. --ar 16:9
name: old-pepsi-machine-value-image-2.png

prompt: Detailed macro photograph focusing on the coin mechanism and selection buttons of a vintage 1950s Pepsi machine. The shot captures the texture of the painted metal, the wear on the chrome coin slot bezel, and the embossed lettering (e.g., 'INSERT COIN', '10Â¢'). Shallow depth of field keeps the specific details sharp while softly blurring the rest of the machine face. Bright, focused lighting emphasizes the textures and condition, key factors in assessing value. Landscape 16:9 format allows for a close, wide view of these critical components. Ultra-realistic, high resolution. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: old-pepsi-machine-value-image-3.png

prompt: Clean, professional studio photograph showcasing a lineup of three different vintage Pepsi vending machines side-by-side against a seamless, neutral grey background. From left to right: a 1940s/50s chest-style cooler (like an Ideal model), a classic upright 1950s/60s Vendo machine, and a slightly later, more angular 1970s model. Even, bright studio lighting ensures all machines are clearly visible. The 16:9 widescreen format perfectly accommodates the comparison, allowing viewers to appreciate the design evolution and differences that affect value. Photorealistic, catalog style, sharp focus across all subjects. --ar 16:9
name: old-pepsi-machine-value-image-4.png

prompt: Nostalgic, cinematic photorealistic scene set at dusk outside a retro 1950s American gas station or diner. A classic, illuminated Pepsi vending machine (e.g., Vendo 44) stands prominently near the entrance, casting a soft glow. Period details like neon signs, chrome trim on the building, and perhaps a vintage car parked nearby are visible. The 16:9 composition places the machine on the left third, allowing the eye to take in the atmospheric environment. Warm, inviting lighting evokes a sense of time and place, highlighting the machine's historical context and appeal. --ar 16:9 --style raw
